volt_distr Documentation

volt_distr: volt_distr

volt_distr

  • Homepage: http://ros.org/wiki/volt_distr

    • volt_distr is a ROS package for recording and visualizing voltage distributions. The package consists of one node and two helper classes.

    Code API

    • Run the voltage distribution node by creating a VoltDistr object.
    • To add a dish state to the data: VoltDistrCreator::add
    • To save the data to a CSV file: VoltDistrCreator::toFile
    • To get an array of percent-negative values: VoltDistrCreator::getPercents
    • To make an image of the percent-negative values: VoltDistrViz::draw
    • To truncate voltage data (may make histogram much easier to read): VoltDistrCreator::setDoTruncateVolts

    ROS API

    List of nodes:

    • volt_distr

    volt_distr

    This node receives dish states from a receiver node and then maintains a voltage histogram for each channel. It then will save this data as a CSV file and/or an image.

    Usage

    $ rosrun volt_distr volt_distr

    ROS topics

    Subscribes to:

    • "dish_states_to_volt_distr": [neuro_recv/dish_state] incoming dish states

    Publishes to:

    • N/A

    ROS parameters

    Reads the following parameters from the parameter server

    • volt_distr_log_path
    • volt_distr_img_path
    • do_truncate_volts

    Sets the following parameters on the parameter server

    • N/A
